alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Knox; Peoria; Stark; Tazewell; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 7:17AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Marshall, northwestern Woodford, northeastern Fulton, southern Stark, southern Knox, northwestern Tazewell and Peoria Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 716 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Williamsfield, or 15 miles east of Galesburg, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Peoria, Canton, East Peoria, Washington, Bartonville, Chillicothe, Creve Coeur, West Peoria, Metamora, Germantown Hills, Abingdon, Farmington, Elmwood, Bellevue, Princeville, Rome, Wyoming, Dunlap, Hanna City and Glasford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 474 between mile markers 0 and 9. Interstate 74 between mile markers 56 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Lincoln.

area.areaDesc: Fulton; Knox; Peoria; Stark; Tazewell; Woodford
